intro: Scleria lateritica, commonly known as the laterite scleria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly in regions with lateritic soils. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, wiry stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or brown in color. Scleria lateritica is adapted to grow in dry, well-drained environments, making it a resilient plant in arid conditions.
